CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 21, 1949, p. 12, reads: "The Pride...of the Farmers Pride Centre Avenue market, recently opened near the corner of Fitzpatrick Street, is this happy staff of workers who see to it that the choice freshly killed poultry is delivered with a smile to the hundreds of Hill District customers who flock to the store each day. Pictured are, left to right: Vida Stringer, Loamie Williams, Dutch Sheetz, manager; Josephine James, Don Kester, assistant manager; Alice Dial, Doris DeLany and Joseph Jones, who works in both the downtown and Centre Avenue markets, and whose idea it was to open the Hill District market. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of employees of Farmers Pride market, from left: Vida Stringer, Loamie Williams, Dutch Sheetz, Josephine James, Don Kester, Alice Dial, Doris DeLany, and Joseph Jones, posed behind display of chicken, Centre Avenue near Fitzpatrick Street
